message: I'm excited to offer you this incredible product for a one-time price of $15,000. I think you'll find it's a great value and will bring significant benefits to your business.
Thank you for the offer, Alice. I'm interested in the product, but $15,000 is a bit outside my budget. I'm willing to pay $8,500 for it. Would you be open to that?

I understand that $8,500 is a bit lower than I was hoping for, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I can offer the product to you for $13,000. This is a fair price that I think you'll find reasonable, considering the value it will bring to your business.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $13,000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm really interested in this product, and I'm prepared to pay $10,000. This is a fair price that reflects the value I see in this product and allows us both to reach a mutually beneficial agreement. Let's try to make this happen.

I appreciate your persistence, Bob. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $10,000. I'm willing to meet you in the middle again, but this time at $11,500. I think this is a fair price that reflects the value of the product and my initial asking price.
